HOUSTON INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT
1300 Capitol Avenue
HOUSTON 2, TEXAS
WILLIAM E. MORELAND
SUPERINTENDENT
March 29, 1956
Mr, Harry Skornia
Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
It was wonderful to have you with us in Detroit, I was never so
surprised to see anyone as I was to see you walk in the door of our
television seminar, I think you know the sincerity with which all
of our DAVI members are facing the possibilities which television
offers for each of our institutions. We are thrilled with its
possibilities and are stimulated by the leadership of folk like
you who can help point direction for all of us. You are doing a
great job, Harry, and you certainly made a most valuable contribu¬
tion to our DAVI sessions.
APR 2 «55 pB
1
I spoke with Floyde Brooker before I left Detroit relative to having
general session program at the next convention on television,
and tentatively, he has given me his wholehearted approval of the
idea. We will be grateful for any suggestions you might have re¬
garding this program. It will be held in Washington, D. C., approxi¬
mately March 15 of next year. Be sure to put this on your calendar.
Again let me say a personal thank you for all the many contributions
you made to the DAVI convention.
Sincerely,
HAROLD E. WIGREN
Director
Audio-Visual Education
